title: Ticket #961: STARTD_CRON function disagrees with documentation: PERIOD
description:
http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.4/3_3Configuration.html#18521

The documentation says the _PERIOD defaults to seconds if no unit is provided, the code does something else: 

$ _CONDOR_STARTD_CRON_JOBLIST=TEST _CONDOR_STARTD_CRON_TEST_EXECUTABLE=someprogram _CONDOR_STARTD_CRON_TEST_PERIOD=5 condor_startd -t -f
...
11/17 11:35:35 CronMgr: Constructing 'startd'
11/17 11:35:35 CronMgr: Setting name to 'startd'
11/17 11:35:35 CronMgr: Setting parameter base to 'startd'
11/17 11:35:35 CronMgr: Invalid period modifier '�' for job TEST (5)
11/17 11:35:35 Cron: Can't create job for 'TEST'
11/17 11:35:35 CronMgr: Done processing job 'TEST'
11/17 11:35:35 CronMgr: Doing config (initial)
remarks:
2010-Jul-20 15:34:02 by slauson:
The problem was that modifier was undefined when no unit was provided. Here's my simple fix: 

diff --git a/src/condor_c++_util/cronmgr.cpp b/src/condor_c++_util/cronmgr.cpp
index eb5224c..3ae21d4 100644
--- a/src/condor_c++_util/cronmgr.cpp
+++ b/src/condor_c++_util/cronmgr.cpp
@@ -561,7 +561,7 @@ CronMgrBase::ParseJobList( const char *jobListString )
                                         jobName );
                        jobOk = false;
                } else {
-                       char    modifier;
+                       char    modifier = 'S';
                        int             num = sscanf( paramPeriod.Value(), "%d%c",
                                                                  &jobPeriod, &modifier );
                        if ( num < 1 ) {
@@ -573,7 +573,7 @@ CronMgrBase::ParseJobList( const char *jobListString )
                        } else {
                                // Check the modifier
                                modifier = toupper( modifier );
-                               if ( ( 0 == modifier ) || ( 'S' == modifier ) ) {       // Seconds
+                               if ( ( 'S' == modifier ) ) {    // Seconds
                                        // Do nothing
                                } else if ( 'M' == modifier ) {
                                        jobPeriod *= 60;
check_ins: 2010-Jul-29 14:40   Check-in [18653]: Fixed STARTD_CRON function to use seconds as a default to agree with documentation. (#961). (By Josh Slauson )
